content: List a few computer programs useful for freelancers that not only provide high performance but also offer cross-platform compatibility. Additionally, please include at least one program that requires advanced knowledge and skills in coding to operate effectively. Please present the list in the table below with the following columns: program name, brief description, operating system compatibility, and required level of technical expertise. Finally, provide a code snippet or a link to the program's source code for at least one of the programs listed.

Here's a list of computer programs that are useful for freelancers, offering high performance and cross-platform compatibility:

| Program Name      | Brief Description                                                    | Operating System Compatibility | Required Level of Technical Expertise |
|-------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------|---------------------------------------|
| **LibreOffice**   | A powerful open-source office suite that includes word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, and more. | Windows, macOS, Linux          | Basic                                |
| **GIMP**          | A free and open-source image editor that provides high-quality photo manipulation and creation tools. | Windows, macOS, Linux          | Intermediate                         |
| **Blender**       | A comprehensive 3D creation suite supporting modeling, animation, simulation, rendering, and more. | Windows, macOS, Linux          | Intermediate to Advanced             |
| **Visual Studio Code** | A versatile code editor with support for debugging, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, and more. | Windows, macOS, Linux          | Intermediate                         |
| **Inkscape**      | A professional vector graphics editor that is open-source and supports numerous design workflows. | Windows, macOS, Linux          | Intermediate                         |
| **Docker**        | A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers. It allows developers to package applications with all their dependencies. | Windows, macOS, Linux          | Advanced                             |

### Example Code Snippet for Docker

Docker is a tool that requires more advanced technical skills, especially in understanding containerization and deployment. Below is a simple Dockerfile example that sets up a basic Python application:

```Dockerfile
# Use an official Python runtime as a parent image
FROM python:3.9-slim

# Set the working directory in the container
WORKDIR /app

# Copy the current directory contents into the container at /app
ADD . /app

# Install any needed packages specified in requirements.txt
RUN pip install --no-cache-dir -r requirements.txt

# Make port 80 available to the world outside this container
EXPOSE 80

# Define environment variable
ENV NAME World

# Run app.py when the container launches
CMD ["python", "app.py"]
```

For more information and to explore Docker further, you can visit the [Docker GitHub repository](https://github.com/docker/docker-ce).
